class_description: The size and precision of this type depend on the CPU architecture. When you build for a 64-bit CPU, the CGFloat type is a 64-bit, IEEE double-precision floating point type, equivalent to the Double type. When you build for a 32-bit CPU, the CGFloat type is a 32-bit, IEEE single-precision floating point type, equivalent to the Float type.

Methods.method_declar: init()

Methods.method_description: value rounded to the closest representable Self.

Methods.method_description: Creates a new instance from the given value, rounded to the closest possible representation.

params.param_description: A floating-point value to be converted.

init(bitPattern: UInt)

params.param_description: A floating-point value to be converted.

Methods.method_declar: init?<Source>(exactly value: Source) where Source : BinaryFloatingPoint

Methods.method_description: Combines sign, exponent and significand bit patterns to produce a floating-point value.
Methods.method_declar: init(sign: FloatingPointSign, exponentBitPattern: UInt, significandBitPattern: UInt)

Methods.method_description: Creates a new floating-point value using the sign of one value and the magnitude of another.

params.param_description: A value from which to use the sign. The result of the initializer has the same sign as signOf.
A value from which to use the magnitude. The result of the initializer has the same magnitude as magnitudeOf.

Methods.method_declar: init(signOf: CGFloat, magnitudeOf: CGFloat)
mutating func addProduct(_ lhs: CGFloat, _ rhs: CGFloat)

Methods.method_description: Returns the result of adding the product of the two given values to this value, computed without intermediate rounding.

params.param_description: One of the values to multiply before adding to this value.

Methods.method_declar: func addingProduct(_ lhs: CGFloat, _ rhs: CGFloat) -> CGFloat

return_description: The product of lhs and rhs, added to this value.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Self x such that self.distance(to: x) approximates n.
Methods.method_declar: func advanced(by amount: CGFloat) -> CGFloat

Methods.method_description: Returns a stride x such that self.advanced(by: x) approximates other.
Methods.method_declar: func distance(to other: CGFloat) -> CGFloat
func encode(to encoder: Encoder) throws
mutating func formRemainder(dividingBy other: CGFloat)
mutating func formSquareRoot()

Methods.method_description: Replace self with the remainder of self divided by other using truncating division. Similar to the C standard library function fmod.
Methods.method_declar: mutating func formTruncatingRemainder(dividingBy other: CGFloat)

Methods.method_description: IEEE 754 equality predicate.
Methods.method_declar: func isEqual(to other: CGFloat) -> Bool

Methods.method_declar: func isLess(than other: CGFloat) -> Bool

Methods.method_description: IEEE 754 less-than-or-equal predicate.
Methods.method_declar: func isLessThanOrEqualTo(_ other: CGFloat) -> Bool

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether this instance should precede or tie positions with the given value in an ascending sort.

params.param_description: A floating-point value to compare to this value.

Methods.method_declar: func isTotallyOrdered(belowOrEqualTo other: CGFloat) -> Bool

return_description: true if this value is ordered below or the same as other in a total ordering of the floating-point type; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_description: Replace self with its additive inverse.
Methods.method_declar: mutating func negate()

return_description: The remainder of this value divided by other.

Methods.method_description: Rounds this value to an integral value using “schoolbook rounding.”
Methods.method_declar: mutating func round()
mutating func round(_ rule: FloatingPointRoundingRule)

Methods.method_description: Returns this value rounded to an integral value using “schoolbook rounding.”
Methods.method_declar: func rounded() -> CGFloat

return_description: The nearest integral value, or, if two integral values are equally close, the integral value with greater magnitude.

Methods.method_description: Returns this value rounded to an integral value using the specified rounding rule.
Methods.method_declar: func rounded(_ rule: FloatingPointRoundingRule) -> CGFloat

return_description: The integral value found by rounding using rule.

Methods.method_description: Returns the square root of the value, rounded to a representable value.
Methods.method_declar: func squareRoot() -> CGFloat

return_description: The square root of the value.

Methods.method_description: Returns the remainder of this value divided by the given value using truncating division.

params.param_description: The value to use when dividing this value.

Methods.method_declar: func truncatingRemainder(dividingBy other: CGFloat) -> CGFloat

return_description: The remainder of this value divided by other using truncating division.

Methods.method_description: Returns the greater of the two given values.
Methods.method_declar: static func maximum(_ x: CGFloat, _ y: CGFloat) -> CGFloat

return_description: The greater of x and y, or whichever is a number if the other is NaN.

Methods.method_description: Returns the value with greater magnitude.
Methods.method_declar: static func maximumMagnitude(_ x: CGFloat, _ y: CGFloat) -> CGFloat

return_description: Whichever of x or y has greater magnitude, or whichever is a number if the other is NaN.

Methods.method_description: Returns the lesser of the two given values.
Methods.method_declar: static func minimum(_ x: CGFloat, _ y: CGFloat) -> CGFloat

return_description: The minimum of x and y, or whichever is a number if the other is NaN.

Methods.method_description: Returns the value with lesser magnitude.
Methods.method_declar: static func minimumMagnitude(_ x: CGFloat, _ y: CGFloat) -> CGFloat

return_description: Whichever of x or y has lesser magnitude, or whichever is a number if the other is NaN.

Methods.method_description: Returns a random value within the specified range.

params.param_description: The range in which to create a random value. Must be finite.

Methods.method_declar: static func random(in range: ClosedRange<CGFloat>) -> CGFloat

return_description: A random value within the bounds of range.

Methods.method_description: Returns a random value within the specified range.

params.param_description: The range in which to create a random value. range must be finite and non-empty.

Methods.method_declar: static func random(in range: Range<CGFloat>) -> CGFloat

return_description: A random value within the bounds of range.

Methods.method_description: Returns a random value within the specified range, using the given generator as a source for randomness.

params.param_description: The range in which to create a random value. Must be finite.
The random number generator to use when creating the new random value.

Methods.method_declar: static func random<T>(in range: ClosedRange<CGFloat>, using generator: inout T) -> CGFloat where T : RandomNumberGenerator

return_description: A random value within the bounds of range.

Methods.method_description: Returns a random value within the specified range, using the given generator as a source for randomness.

params.param_description: The range in which to create a random value. range must be finite and non-empty.
The random number generator to use when creating the new random value.

Methods.method_declar: static func random<T>(in range: Range<CGFloat>, using generator: inout T) -> CGFloat where T : RandomNumberGenerator

return_description: A random value within the bounds of range.

static func -= (lhs: inout CGFloat, rhs: CGFloat)

Methods.method_declar: prefix static func ... (maximum: CGFloat) -> PartialRangeThrough<CGFloat>

The upper bound for the range.

Methods.method_declar: static func ... (minimum: CGFloat, maximum: CGFloat) -> ClosedRange<CGFloat>

The upper bound for the range.

Methods.method_declar: static func ..< (minimum: CGFloat, maximum: CGFloat) -> Range<CGFloat>

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is greater than or equal to that of the second argument.

Vars.var_description: The least-magnitude member of the binade of self.
A mirror that reflects the CGFloat instance.
A textual representation of self.
The integer part of the base-r logarithm of the magnitude of self, where r is the radix (2 for binary, 10 for decimal). Implements the IEEE 754 logB operation.
The raw encoding of the exponent field of the floating-point value.
The hash value.
True if and only if self is canonical.
true iff self is zero, subnormal, or normal (not infinity or NaN).
true iff self is infinity.
true iff self is NaN.
true iff self is normal (not zero, subnormal, infinity, or NaN).
True if and only if self is a signaling NaN.
true iff self is subnormal.
true iff self is +0.0 or -0.0.
The native value.
The native value.
The greatest representable value that compares less than this value.
The least representable value that compares greater than self.
minus if the sign bit of self is set, and plus otherwise. Implements the IEEE 754 signbit operation.
The significant digits, or mantissa, of the floating-point number.
The raw encoding of the significand field of the floating-point value.
The number of bits required to represent significand.
The unit in the last place of self.
The number of bits used to represent the exponent.
The greatest finite number.
The positive infinity.
The least positive number.
The least positive normal number.
A quiet NaN.
The mathematical constant π (3.14159…).
The radix, or base of exponentiation, for this floating-point type.
A signaling NaN (not-a-number).
For fixed-width floating-point types, this is the number of fractional significand bits.
The unit in the last place of 1.0.
